integrations.title: Integrations
integrations.subtitle: Connect your favorite apps and automate your workflows

whatsapp.description: Send automated messages, notifications, and updates to your customers via WhatsApp Business API.

slack.description: Send messages, notifications, and updates to Slack channels and direct messages.

telegram.description: Send automated messages and notifications through Telegram bots.

discord.description: Send messages and notifications to Discord channels via webhooks.

gmail.description: Send emails, read inbox, and automate email workflows with Gmail.

outlook.description: Manage emails, calendar events, and contacts with Microsoft Outlook.

sendgrid.description: Send transactional and marketing emails at scale with SendGrid.

google_sheets.description: Read, write, and update data in Google Sheets spreadsheets.

google_drive.description: Upload, download, and manage files in Google Drive storage.

notion.description: Create, update, and manage pages and databases in Notion workspace.

airtable.description: Manage records in Airtable bases and automate database workflows.

trello.description: Create cards, manage boards, and automate project workflows in Trello.

shopify.description: Manage products, orders, and customers in your Shopify store.

woocommerce.description: Automate order processing and inventory management for WooCommerce stores.

stripe.description: Process payments, manage subscriptions, and handle invoices with Stripe.

instagram.description: Post content, manage comments, and analyze engagement on Instagram.

twitter.description: Post tweets, monitor mentions, and automate social media workflows.

facebook.description: Post updates, manage pages, and automate Facebook marketing.

linkedin.description: Share content, manage company pages, and automate LinkedIn presence.

hubspot.description: Manage contacts, deals, and automate sales workflows in HubSpot CRM.

salesforce.description: Manage leads, opportunities, and customer data in Salesforce.

github.description: Manage repositories, issues, and automate development workflows.

gitlab.description: Automate CI/CD pipelines and manage GitLab projects.

google_calendar.description: Create events, manage calendars, and automate scheduling workflows.

calendly.description: Automate meeting scheduling and manage Calendly bookings.

typeform.description: Collect form responses and automate survey workflows.

google_forms.description: Collect and process Google Forms responses automatically.

openai.description: Generate text, analyze content, and build AI-powered workflows with GPT.

emptyState.noResults: No integrations found. Try adjusting your search or filters.

error.title: Failed to Load Integrations
error.description: We couldn't load the integrations. Please try again.

form.apiKeyTooltip: A unique identifier that authenticates your application with the service
form.apiSecretTooltip: An additional security credential used alongside your API key
form.webhookUrlTooltip: A URL that receives real-time notifications from the service
form.apiKeyHelp: Need help finding your credentials? Check our step-by-step guide.
form.webhookHelp: Not sure how to create a webhook? We'll walk you through it.
form.oauthComingSoon: OAuth2 authentication is coming soon. For now, please use API key-based integrations.

setupGuide.tooltip: Step-by-step instructions to get your credentials
setupGuide.title: Setup Guide:
setupGuide.description: Follow these steps to connect your integration

step1.title: Open Telegram and Find BotFather
step1.description: Search for @BotFather in Telegram and start a chat.

step2.title: Create a New Bot
step2.description: Send the command /newbot to BotFather and follow the instructions.
step2.tip1: Choose a unique name for your bot

step3.title: Copy Your API Token
step3.description: BotFather will send you an API token. Copy this token.
step3.tip2: You can always get your token again by sending /token to BotFather

prerequisites.0: You need 'Manage Webhooks' permission in the server

step1.title: Open Your Discord Server
step1.description: Go to the Discord server where you want to add the webhook.
step1.tip1: You need 'Manage Webhooks' permission in the server

step2.title: Open Server Settings
step2.description: Click on the server name and select 'Server Settings' > 'Integrations'.

step3.title: Create a Webhook
step3.description: Click 'Create Webhook', choose a channel, and give it a name.
step3.tip1: Choose the channel where you want messages to appear
step3.tip2: You can customize the webhook's name and avatar

step4.title: Copy Webhook URL
step4.description: Click 'Copy Webhook URL' and paste it in the setup form.

step1.title: Sign in to SendGrid
step1.description: Go to SendGrid and sign in to your account.

step2.title: Navigate to API Keys
step2.description: Go to Settings > API Keys in the left sidebar.

step3.title: Create API Key
step3.description: Click 'Create API Key', give it a name, and choose 'Full Access' permissions.
step3.tip1: For security, you can choose 'Restricted Access' and select only the permissions you need
step3.tip2: Give your key a descriptive name like 'Flowin Integration'

step4.title: Copy Your API Key
step4.description: Copy the API key immediately - you won't be able to see it again!
step4.tip2: If you lose it, you'll need to create a new one

step1.title: Sign in to Stripe Dashboard
step1.description: Go to the Stripe Dashboard and sign in.

step2.title: Navigate to API Keys
step2.description: Click on 'Developers' in the top menu, then 'API keys'.

step3.title: Copy Your Secret Key
step3.description: Copy the 'Secret key' (starts with sk_test_ for test mode or sk_live_ for live mode).
step3.tip2: Never share your secret key publicly
step3.tip3: You can also use restricted keys for better security

step1.title: Sign in to OpenAI
step1.description: Go to the OpenAI platform and sign in.

step2.title: Navigate to API Keys
step2.description: Click on your profile icon and select 'API keys'.

step3.title: Create New Secret Key
step3.description: Click 'Create new secret key', give it a name, and copy it immediately.
step3.tip1: You can only see the key once
step3.tip2: Set usage limits to control costs
step3.tip3: Monitor your usage in the dashboard

prerequisites.0: Admin access to your Slack workspace

step1.title: Create a Slack App
step1.description: Go to the Slack API website and create a new app.

step2.title: Configure OAuth & Permissions
step2.description: Go to 'OAuth & Permissions' and add the required scopes for your integration.

step3.title: Install App to Workspace
step3.description: Click 'Install to Workspace' and authorize the app.
step3.tip1: Make sure you have admin permissions in the workspace
step3.tip2: You can always modify scopes later if needed

step4.title: Copy Bot User OAuth Token
step4.description: Copy the 'Bot User OAuth Token' that starts with 'xoxb-'.
step4.tip1: This token allows your app to act on behalf of your bot user

step1.title: Go to Personal Access Tokens
step1.description: Navigate to GitHub Settings > Developer settings > Personal access tokens.

step2.title: Generate New Token
step2.description: Click 'Generate new token (classic)' and give it a descriptive name.
step2.tip2: Set an expiration date for security

step3.title: Select Scopes and Copy Token
step3.description: Select the required scopes for your integration and copy the generated token.
step3.tip2: You can only see the token once - save it securely

prerequisites.0: A Notion account with workspace access

step1.title: Create a New Integration
step1.description: Go to Notion integrations page and create a new integration.

step2.title: Configure Integration Settings
step2.description: Give your integration a name and select the workspace it can access.

step3.title: Copy Internal Integration Token
step3.description: Copy the 'Internal Integration Token' from the integration settings.
step3.tip2: Keep this token secure and never share it publicly

step4.title: Share Pages with Integration
step4.description: Go to the Notion pages you want to access and share them with your integration.
step4.tip1: You need to manually share each page or database with your integration

step1.title: Create a Google Cloud Project
step1.description: Go to Google Cloud Console and create a new project or select an existing one.

step2.title: Enable Google Sheets API
step2.description: In the API Library, search for 'Google Sheets API' and enable it.

step3.title: Create Service Account
step3.description: Go to 'IAM & Admin' > 'Service Accounts' and create a new service account.
step3.tip1: Give it a descriptive name like 'Flowin Integration'

step4.title: Generate Service Account Key
step4.description: Click on your service account, go to 'Keys' tab, and create a new JSON key.

step5.title: Share Sheets with Service Account
step5.description: Share your Google Sheets with the service account email address.
step5.tip1: The service account email looks like: your-service@project.iam.gserviceaccount.com
step5.tip2: Give it 'Editor' access to allow reading and writing

prerequisites.1: Admin access to your Shopify store

step1.title: Go to Shopify Admin
step1.description: Sign in to your Shopify admin panel.

step2.title: Navigate to Apps and Sales Channels
step2.description: Go to 'Settings' > 'Apps and sales channels' > 'Develop apps'.

step3.title: Create Private App
step3.description: Click 'Create an app' and give it a name and description.
step3.tip1: Choose a descriptive name like 'Flowin Integration'

step4.title: Configure API Access and Get Tokens
step4.description: Configure the required API scopes and copy the Admin API access token.
step4.tip2: Keep your API credentials secure and never share them publicly

errors.oauthNotImplemented: OAuth2 authentication is not yet implemented
